item.title: Workshop - IEEE ICRA PKM 2021
item.description:
IEEE ICRA Workshop on Parallel robots or not parallel robots? New frontiers of parallel robotics 2021

This workshop aimed at bringing together researchers working in several distinct communities (e.g. soft/continuum robotics, compliant mechanisms, aerial robotics, cable-driven robotics, tensegrity structures, dexterous manipulation and physical interactions), but who have a similar object of investigation in common, i.e. a closed-chain robotic device, so that they could share their experiences, tools, issues; and at fostering researchers to investigate the new issues arising from the development of new types of robots.

Presented a part of the doctoral research, on A Study on Flexible Parallel Robots via Additive Manufacturing, as a contributed paper at this workshop.

Click on the PDF button above to view the draft of the paper submitted for this workshop.
Click on the Slides button above to view the slides presented at this talk.

item.title: Conference - IEEE/ASME AIM 2020
item.description:
IEEE/ASME International Conference on Advanced Intelligent Mechatronics (AIM) 2020

Presented the reasearch work on Constant Length Tendon Routing Mechanism through Axial Joint published in this conference.

Check out the publication here: IEEE-ASME-AIM-2020.
Click on the Slides button above to view the slides presented at this talk.

item.title: Winter School - ROBOZEN 2020
item.description:
International Winter School on Mechanism Design and Motion Planning for Robotics 2020

ROBOzen was oriented to PhD students, young researchers and specialists working in the design of mechanisms and motion planning techniques for robotic and related mechatronic applications. International and Italian experts gave lectures on topics including: (i) Compliant and flexible mechanisms for robotics, (ii) Parallel and Cable-driven mechanisms for robotics, (iii) Trajectory planning for robotics, (iv) Collaborative robots, (v) Mobile robots.

Furthermore, all the student participants were asked to present their related research problems through posters and further share and discuss the solutions toward the same.

Presented a poster on the dotoral reasearch work on Robot Design for Dexterous Manipulation.

Click on the Poster button above to view the poster presented at this talk.

item.title: Summer School - PKM 2018
item.description:
2nd Summer School on Parallel Kinematic Manipulators 2018

The goal of this summer school was to share the knowledge on parallel kinematics manipulators (PKM) during a whole week, targeting realistic prototypes to face real problems met in the industry. Various lectures and simulation labs were conducted covering the topics of design, kinematics, dynamics, control strategies, visual servoing for the PKMs with a special focus on cable-driven parallel robots. All the student participants were asked to present their related research problems through posters and further share and discuss the solutions toward the same.

Presented a poster on the dotoral reasearch work on Robot Design for Dexterous Manipulation.

Click on the Poster button above to view the poster presented at this talk.
